intro: Cordula × shipwayae, commonly known as the hybrid cordula, is a rare and ornamental plant belonging to the family Meliaceae. It is a naturally occurring hybrid between Cordula bucharica and Cordula sphaerocarpa, characterized by its unique foliage and floral structure. The plant typically exhibits compound leaves with serrated margins and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white or pale yellow. It thrives in temperate climates and is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal in botanical gardens. Due to its limited natural range, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study and conservation efforts.
